context: The Finnish word 'hyvin' is an adverb that generally means 'well'. It can also translate to 'good' or 'fine', depending on the context. It has comparative forms like 'paremmin' (better) and superlative form 'parhaiten' (best). The word can be used to describe how something is done ('Hän laulaa hyvin' - She sings well), a state of being ('Voimme elää hyvin yhdessä' - We can live well together), or an emotional state ('Olen hyvin iloinen nähdessäni sinut' - I am very happy to see you).
